content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above. The points <math alttext="with coordinates 2 comma 7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="coordinates 4 comma 18.8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>18.8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are on the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an equation for the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
